column4: Welcome, you are now talking to an AI doctor. As I am part of a scientific experiment, I would appreciate it if you could take the time to answer a super short questionnaire at the end of the interview. Tap Speak to ask your question and then tap Send to submit it to me.
OK i have headaches for the last three weeks 2 weeks umm and i don't know to what it is you can you help me
Yes, I can help. Can you tell me more about your headaches? Are the headaches in the front or sides of your head? Are the headaches sharp, throbbing, or pressure-like? Do you have any other symptoms?
should i have to speak english so yes i have a headache in front of my head just above my eyes and pressure liked so yes and i don't have any other symptoms

It sounds like you may have a tension headache. Tension headaches are caused by stress and tension on the muscles in the head and neck. You may experience a dull, pressure-like pain with a feeling of tightness around the forehead or on the sides and back of the head. Treatment for tension headache typically involves relieving stress and relaxing the tense muscles. Over-the-counter medications are usually enough to relieve the pain. In severe cases, your doctor may prescribe medications or physical therapy.
You're welcome. If your symptoms persist or become more frequent, don't hesitate to consult your doctor for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan.
